intro: Pygeum monticola, commonly known as the mountain African knobthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers followed by small, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and on mountain slopes. Pygeum monticola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
